{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the information provided in the documents, lipids are described as a diverse and ubiquitous group of compounds. They are considered to be a catchall for relatively water-insoluble or nonpolar compounds of biological origin. Lipids include waxes, fatty acids, phospholipids, glycolipids, and terpenoids. Therefore, lipids are a heterogeneous group of compounds.", "answer_choice": "A. Heterogenous"}
